transcript: what's the most painful lesson you've learned that the heaviest things in life aren't iron or gold but unmade decisions when I got into a head-on collision when I was 26 from a DUI I had a performance coach at the time that was like these unmade decisions that you're choosing not to confront are literally going to kill you he's like and you just got lucky because you got a second shot that was a painful lesson in that like it was a massive wake-up call that I had all this fear around decisions which was really just hard conversations that I was postponing that I needed to have and I think when I was confronted with my own death I was able to like nut up and actually have this conversation because I was like oh if I don't do this I will stress myself out enough that I don't want to be here
